meaningMnemonic: A <radical>tree</radical> that does well in the <radical>wind</radical> is a <kanji>maple</kanji> tree. Maple trees don't have fruit so the wind can't knock anything off of it. That's why they thrive well in windy places!
readingMnemonic: When the wind goes through the <kanji>maple</kanji> tree you know it's <reading>kite day</reading> (かえで)!
